results.name: Least number k > 0 such that (2*n-1)^k - 2 is prime, or 0 if no such number exists.
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..152 (terms 1..143 from Robert Price)
Carlos Rivera, Puzzle 887. p(n)^c-2 is prime, The Prime Puzzles and Problems Connection.
mathematica: lst = {0}; For[n = 2, n ≤ 143, n++, For[k = 1, k >= 1, k++, If[PrimeQ[(2*n - 1)^k - 2], AppendTo[lst, k]; Break[]]]]; lst
